alert.note: Alert for Brevard (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 7:33PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Brevard. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 733 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Melbourne, Cocoa Beach, Satellite Beach, Camp Holly Fish Camp, Patrick Air Force Base, Merritt Island, West Melbourne, Indian Harbour Beach, Suntree, Viera, South Patrick Shores, Palm Shores, Pineda, Eau Gallie, Space Coast Stadium and June Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
